entry.title: Ubuntu 11.10 WiFi
entry.content:
Recently I upgraded from Linux Mint (Julia) to Ubuntu 11.10. I did so by creating a live USB of the Ubuntu 11.10 iso. Took backup of my stuff from the Mint partition, formatted it and installed Ubuntu over it.
It is a welcome change. Though the Unity interface requires some getting used to.
One of the first things I tried after installing is connecting to the internet. Initially the WiFi in Ubuntu 11.10 was not working. Here is how I got the WiFi working.

Generally when one installs Ubuntu, the WiFi drivers can be found in the 'Additional Drivers' and activated from there. But in my case, it was not able to find any driver. When I clicked on the network icon on the top panel, it showed "Wireless is disabled".
I tried googling this, got some tips but none of them helped.

So I downloaded bcmwl-kernel-source package from here on a friend's laptop. Tried to install it on my laptop.
dpkg -i bcmwl-kernel-source_5.100.82.38+bdcom-0ubuntu4_amd64.deb
This showed that a few dependents were missing. So downloaded dkms and patch ie the missing packages.
dpkg -i patch_2.6.1-2_amd64.deb
dpkg -i dkms_2.2.0.2-1ubuntu4_all.deb
dpkg -i bcmwl-kernel-source_5.100.82.38+bdcom-0ubuntu4_amd64.deb 
All the packages were installed successfully. Now, the Broadcom STA driver was visible in 'Additional Drivers'. WiFi was working after enabling the driver (You might have to restart) .

If you have the "Wireless is disabled by hardware switch" message when you click the network icon, make sure that if you have a switch on the side of your laptop, it is turned on. Also, press the wireless key on the keyboard which is mostly F2 or 'Fn + F2' to turn On wireless. More details here.

entry.title: Worst experience installing Linux till date
entry.content:
Currently I have a dual boot of Windows 7 and Ubuntu 9.10. 
I hardly use the ubuntu partition. Instead i use Fedora 13 on a VirtualBox on Windows 7.
I have been planning to update the other partition for a long time now, but thanks to VOLSBB, I didn't yet. It's a monday morning and I have nothing better to do. Lets update :)

[Hardware Config:  
Processor: Intel Core2Duo P8700 @ 2.53 GHz
RAM: 4GB DDR2
Graphic Card: ATI Mobility Radeon HD 4570.]

7:00 AM :
Thinking of installing Fedora 14 on the Ubuntu partition. I have the Fedora 14 x86_64 DVD iso image. 3.27 GB. Time to put the 8 GB Transcend USB drive (which i got for free at the Microsoft stall in Chennai @ OSIDays this year) to some good use.
Making live usb using Unetbootin.

7:10 AM :
Live USB created. Now time for installation. Rebooting. F-12. Selected Boot from USB.

7:15 AM :
At the last step of installation the following error pops up:-
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Missing ISO 9660 Image


The installer has tried to mount image #1, but cannot find it 
on the hard drive.


Please copy this image to the drive and click Retry. Click
Exit to abort the installation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What??!! Nothing happens when i retry & clicking exit rebooted the system.
After restarting:-
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
GRUB Loading...
error : file not found
grub rescue >
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I guess GRUB was in the ubuntu partition which got formatted during installation. Dunno what to do now. Can't even log into Windows. So no google help either :(
Looking for help. Found the Ubuntu 9.10 live cd. Booting from it. How to install just GRUB? Not able to install wifi driver while running live, so no Google yet. Can't think of any option other than installing Ubuntu again.

7:50 AM :
Installation taking time. Reading newspaper in the meantime. Australia allout for just 98!! wow!

8:00 AM :
Finally installation completed. Rebooting. Grub menu loaded. Yayy!
Logging in to windows7. Finally Google! Searching the fedora forums to find a solution for the error. Looks like I have to copy the iso image to the root folder of the USB after the creation of live USB. Also, it has been suggested to use Linux Live USB creator or Fedora liveusb-creator.

8:10 AM :
Downloading Linux Live USB creator 2.6. Download speed of 190 kb/s, pretty good for wifi here. :)
Nice colorful interface! Creating live USB.

8:20 AM :
Live USB creation failed. WHY?? Maybe some problem with the iso image. Checking sha256sum. Matches. Then why the error? Should try Fedora liveusb-creator instead.

8:30 AM :
Creation success. Rebooting. F-12. Boot from USB. The screen gets stuck at:-
SYSLINUX 3.85 something something Copyright (c) 1994-2010 H. Peter Anvin et al

What now? 
Rebooting. Logged in to windows7. Google. This is another common error on fedora forums. Will have to update the Syslinux of liveusb-creator to 4.02 or above. Found the solution here. Have to replace the syslinux.exe file with the new one at C:\Program Files\LiveUSB Creator\tools and then run liveusb-creator again. Simple. I love the fedora community!
Done with the updates. Created live USB again. Reboot. F-12. Boot from USB. Anaconda loads. :)

9:15 AM :
Almost at the end of installation and again the Missing ISO 9660 image error. I forgot to copy the iso image to root folder of my usb drive. Damn!
Reboot. GRUB missing. AAAhhhrrghh!!!
Booting from Ubuntu 9.10 live cd. Copying iso image to root folder of USB.
Done. Reboot. F-12. Boot from USB. Installation process.

10:05 AM :
No missing ISO 9660 error this time! :)
Selecting Packages to install. Done. Checking repos. Gives yet another error. NO!! Not now.. grr. Error:-
yum-utils.something.noarch not found. Check the Installation Source.
Reboot or Retry.
Retry displays same thing again.
Rebooting. Installation progress vanishes. Grub not found. Just sad.
10:35 AM :
Have to go out with friends after an hour. Should get the computer working for now. Booting from Ubuntu 9.10 live cd. Not in a mood to install 9.10 again.
Just realized I also have the iso image of Maverick Meerkat.
Using default "Startup Disk Creator" to create live USB for Ubuntu 10.10.
Reboot. F-12. Boot from USB. Hope this works.

11:15 AM :
Success! Logging in to Ubuntu 10.10 Maverick Meerkat. Wifi settings configured. Net working! Now dual boot of Windows 7 and Ubuntu 10.10.

Made lots of mistakes today. Realized that incomplete knowledge does more harm than good. Almost 4 hours spent. Proper knowledge & understanding as well as patience is required. Lesson learned the hard way.
Have to go out now. Will try installing Fedora again tonight. But this time after some research and under guidance!

*EDIT*

I tried installing Fedora 14 again and failed yet again. Used a DVD this time.
The error that I got:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


The file yum-utils-1.1.28-1.fc14.noarch.rpm cannot be opened.
This is due to a missing file, corrupt package or corrupt media. Please verify your installation source.

If you exit, your system will be left in an inconsistent state that will likely require reinstallation.
Reboot Retry




-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Anyway, Now I am using Linux Mint 10 (Gnome x64 Julia).
It is a Ubuntu based Linux distribution.
Screenshots on installing Julia are available here.
It has a new look and feel, a super-cool menu and the best thing is that the terminal greets you every single time with a different thought of the day!




Comments

Paras
And yes, the iso worked in VMWare Workstation the first time without any installation errors. Strange!
Paras
I burned the iso on DVD and tried again. Got the same error. I added the screenshot above. Anyway, for now I am happy with "Julia" and don't really need fedora. Enough time wasted on OS installation already.
Thanks again for the interest. Really appreciate it :)
harsheinstein
the best advice that I can give right now is try that Fed 14 iso on VirtualBox/VMWare (whatever you have). If it runs, then probably it was the installation that messed everything up. If the virtual OS runs, then burn the iso on the DVD and then install it and do a clean install (will take 45 mins if you install all the services).. I have heard people facing problem when then
install it through USB. so give it a shot, if you must..
Paras
Thanks for the reply!
I tried installing fedora again and messed up yet again. :(
But this time the grub commands were useful. i was looking for these commands only. thanks, a big timesaver!

Now I dropped the idea of installing f14. Instead trying Linux Mint 10 "Julia".
harsheinstein
the three problems:
1) stop trying reinstalling Ubuntu everytime.
use these 4 commands on grub command-line to boot Windows:
grub>rootnoverify (hd0,0) #assuming Windows to be in 1st partition
grub>makeactive
grub>chainloader +1
grub>boot
PS:I don't exactly remember the order of 2nd and 3rd command. If it doesn't work, execute the third one before the second one.

2)even I have heard that it's only liveusb-creator that works for fedora. I never tried to make a foray why. if you do and find out why, do let me know :D

3)i don't have a freaking idea about that yum-utils problem.. try re-installing it. may be, it just works out of sheer luck. :)

All the best with your re-installation

PPS: Do clean install.
